DataElement.preferredName: Thrombocytopenia Due To Repeat Failure Response To Platelet Transfusion Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text indicator to determine if the patient with thrombocytopenia is due to platelet transfusion refractoriness.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Thrombocytopenia Due To Repeat Failure Response To Platelet Transfusion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test result indicating that there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood._Caused by or resulting from._Make or do or perform again._A lack of occurrence or performance._Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The transfer of blood platelets from a donor to a recipient or reinfusion to the donor._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition in which there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result indicating that there is an abnormally small number of platelets in the circulating blood.

Property.preferredName: Due To Repeat Failure Response To Platelet Transfusion Present
Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or resulting from.:Make or do or perform again.:A lack of occurrence or performance.:Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:The transfer of blood platelets from a donor to a recipient or reinfusion to the donor.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Make or do or perform again.
A lack of occurrence or performance.
Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
The infusion of platelets into the bloodstream.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
